    IYRCCellModifier, YRCExtendedCellModifier

extends java.lang.Object

      Key indicating that the modified value is a correct value.

      Key indicating that the modified value may not be perfectly OK and a warning needs to be displayed for the same.

    • Method Detail

      • allowModify

        protected abstract boolean allowModify(java.lang.String property,
                                       java.lang.String value,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        This is called to check if it is OK to modify the current cell. If it is OK to modify the cell return true, else return false.
        Parameters:
        property - The property associated with the current table column.
        value - The current value in the cell.
        element - The element corresponding to the current row.
        Returns:
        Return true if the cell needs to be modified, else return false.

      • allowModifiedValue

        protected abstract int allowModifiedValue(java.lang.String property,
                                          java.lang.String value,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        This method is used to check if the vaue modified by the user is correct. If it is OK to modify the current value, getModifiedValue(String, String, Element) is called and the entered value is formatted according to its data type. In rest of the cases no further processing is done. In case of error, the cell is set in error.
        Parameters:
        property - The property associated with the current table column.
        value - The modified value in the cell.
        element - The element corresponding to the current row.
        Returns:
        A value indicating the stauts of the modified value.
        See Also:
        MODIFY_OK, MODIFY_WARNING, MODIFY_ERROR

      • getModifiedValue

        protected abstract java.lang.String getModifiedValue(java.lang.String property,
                                                     java.lang.String value,
                                                     org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        If the user has entered a correct value which is OK to modify, this method is called for further modification if required. This may be used as an opportunity to perform application specifc operations after user has entered the value.
        Parameters:
        property - The property associated with the current table column.
        value - The modified value in the cell.
        element - The element corresponding to the current row.
        Returns:
        The value that should be updated in the table's model.

      • removeFromError

        public abstract void removeFromError(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                     java.lang.String property)
        Utility method to remove the table cell from error.
        Parameters:
        element - The element corresponding to the cell's row.
        property - The property corresponding to the cell's column.

      • addToError

        public abstract void addToError(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                java.lang.String property,
                                java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Utility method to add the table cell for the table item in error. When called, then YRCBehavior.hasError() will return a true value.
        Parameters:
        element - The element corresponding to the cell's row.
        property - The property corresponding to the cell's column.

      • update

        public abstract void update(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                            java.lang.String[] properties)
        Utility method to be used to update the table viewer UI programmatically. This should be called when an element has changed in the model, in order to have the viewer accurately reflect the model. This method only affects the viewer, not the model.
        Parameters:
        element - Element to be updated.
        properties - The columns of the above element to be updated.

      • editCell

        public abstract void editCell(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                              java.lang.String property)
        Method to edit the a cell of the table. The cell must be editable.
        Parameters:
        element - The element corresponding to the cell's row.
        property - The property corresponding to the cell's column.

      • moveToNextEditableCell

        public abstract void moveToNextEditableCell(org.w3c.dom.Element itemData,
                                            java.lang.String columnProperty)
        Utility method to move to a editable cell next to the current cell as defined by the input parameters.
        Parameters:
        itemData - The current element corresponding to a cell in the table.
        columnProperty - The property associated column.

      • moveToNextEditableCell

        public abstract void moveToNextEditableCell()
        Utility method to move to a editable cell next to the currently selected cell.

      • closeCellEditor

        public abstract void closeCellEditor()
        Closes cell editor if there is an open one in the table.
